member.summary: Makes this buffer read only.

member.name: M:MongoDB.Bson.IO.IByteBuffer.ReadBackingBytes(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Read directly from the backing bytes. The returned ArraySegment points directly to the backing bytes for the current position and you can read the bytes directly from there. If the backing bytes happen to span a chunk boundary shortly after the current position there might not be enough bytes left in the current chunk in which case the returned ArraySegment will have a Count of zero and you should call ReadBytes instead.
When ReadBackingBytes returns the position will have been advanced by count bytes *if and only if* there were count bytes left in the current chunk.
member.param: The number of bytes you need to read.
member.returns: An ArraySegment pointing directly to the backing bytes for the current position.

member.name: M:MongoDB.Bson.IO.IByteBuffer.ReadByte
member.summary: Reads a byte.

member.name: M:MongoDB.Bson.IO.IByteBuffer.ReadBytes(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads bytes.

member.name: M:MongoDB.Bson.IO.IByteBuffer.ReadBytes(System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads bytes.

member.name: M:MongoDB.Bson.IO.IByteBuffer.WriteBackingBytes(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Write directly to the backing bytes. The returned ArraySegment points directly to the backing bytes for the current position and you can write the bytes directly to there. If the backing bytes happen to span a chunk boundary shortly after the current position there might not be enough bytes left in the current chunk in which case the returned ArraySegment will have a Count of zero and you should call WriteBytes instead.
When WriteBackingBytes returns the position has not been advanced. After you have written up to count bytes directly to the backing bytes advance the position by the number of bytes actually written.
member.returns: An ArraySegment pointing directly to the backing bytes for the current position.

member.name: M:MongoDB.Bson.IO.IByteBuffer.WriteByte(System.Byte)
member.summary: Writes a byte.

member.summary: Writes bytes.
member.param: The bytes (in the form of a byte array).

member.summary: Writes bytes.
member.param: The bytes (in the form of an IByteBuffer).

member.name: M:MongoDB.Bson.IO.ByteArrayBuffer.ReadBackingBytes(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Read directly from the backing bytes. The returned ArraySegment points directly to the backing bytes for the current position and you can read the bytes directly from there. If the backing bytes happen to span a chunk boundary shortly after the current position there might not be enough bytes left in the current chunk in which case the returned ArraySegment will have a Count of zero and you should call ReadBytes instead.
When ReadBackingBytes returns the position will have been advanced by count bytes *if and only if* there were count bytes left in the current chunk.
member.param: The number of bytes you need to read.
member.returns: An ArraySegment pointing directly to the backing bytes for the current position.

member.name: M:MongoDB.Bson.IO.ByteArrayBuffer.ReadByte
member.summary: Reads a byte.

member.name: M:MongoDB.Bson.IO.ByteArrayBuffer.ReadBytes(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads bytes.

member.name: M:MongoDB.Bson.IO.ByteArrayBuffer.ReadBytes(System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads bytes.

member.name: M:MongoDB.Bson.IO.ByteArrayBuffer.WriteBackingBytes(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Write directly to the backing bytes. The returned ArraySegment points directly to the backing bytes for the current position and you can write the bytes directly to there. If the backing bytes happen to span a chunk boundary shortly after the current position there might not be enough bytes left in the current chunk in which case the returned ArraySegment will have a Count of zero and you should call WriteBytes instead.
When WriteBackingBytes returns the position has not been advanced. After you have written up to count bytes directly to the backing bytes advance the position by the number of bytes actually written.
member.returns: An ArraySegment pointing directly to the backing bytes for the current position.

member.name: T:MongoDB.Bson.Serialization.IdGenerators.AscendingGuidGenerator
member.summary: A GUID generator that generates GUIDs in ascending order. To enable an index to make use of the ascending nature make sure to use GuidRepresentation.Standard as the storage representation. Internally the GUID is of the form 8 bytes: Ticks from DateTime.UtcNow.Ticks 3 bytes: hash of machine name 2 bytes: low order bytes of process Id 3 bytes: increment

member.name: T:MongoDB.Bson.Serialization.IIdGenerator
member.summary: An interface implemented by Id generators.

member.summary: Generates an Id for a document.
member.param: The container of the document (will be a MongoCollection when called from the C# driver).

member.name: M:MongoDB.Bson.Serialization.IIdGenerator.IsEmpty(System.Object)
member.summary: Tests whether an Id is empty.
member.returns: True if the Id is empty.

member.name: M:MongoDB.Bson.Serialization.IdGenerators.AscendingGuidGenerator.GenerateId(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Generates an ascending Guid for a document. Consecutive invocations should generate Guids that are ascending from a MongoDB perspective
member.param: The container of the document (will be a MongoCollection when called from the driver).
The document it was generated for.

member.name: M:MongoDB.Bson.Serialization.IdGenerators.AscendingGuidGenerator.GenerateId(System.Int64,System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Generates a Guid for a document. Note - this is purely used for unit testing
member.param: The time portion of the Guid
A 5 byte array with the first 3 bytes representing a machine id and the next 2 representing a process id
The increment portion of the Guid. Used to distinguish between 2 Guids that have the timestamp. Note only the least significant 3 bytes are used.

member.name: M:MongoDB.Bson.Serialization.IdGenerators.AscendingGuidGenerator.IsEmpty(System.Object)
member.summary: Tests whether an id is empty.
member.returns: True if the Id is empty. False otherwise

member.name: M:MongoDB.Bson.Serialization.IdGenerators.AscendingGuidGenerator.GetCurrentProcessId
member.summary: Gets the current process id. This method exists because of how CAS operates on the call stack, checking for permissions before executing the method. Hence, if we inlined this call, the calling method would not execute before throwing an exception requiring the try/catch at an even higher level that we don't necessarily control.

member.summary: Gets an instance of AscendingGuidGenerator.

member.name: M:MongoDB.Bson.ObjectId.GetCurrentProcessId
member.summary: Gets the current process id. This method exists because of how CAS operates on the call stack, checking for permissions before executing the method. Hence, if we inlined this call, the calling method would not execute before throwing an exception requiring the try/catch at an even higher level that we don't necessarily control.
